channel.title: For some reason, its not working

item.title: For some reason, its not working
item.dc:creator: @Nashi Nashi
item.description:
@Nashi wrote:

Why do you use chr?
IsKeyDown(‘A’) is the same as IsKeyDown(Chr(65));
I’m not sure about the Capslock though, Perhaps replace it with Shift and use IsFunctionKeyDown(0);?

Read full topic
item.source: For some reason, its not working

item.title: For some reason, its not working
item.dc:creator: @redragonje65 redragonje65
item.description:
@redragonje65 wrote:

[code]program New;

var
x,y:integer;

procedure c1;

begin
if iskeydown(chr(49)) then
begin
wait(50);
movemouse(231, 105);
wait(50);
clickmouse(231, 105,true);
end;
end;

procedure c2;

begin
if iskeydown(chr(50)) then
begin
wait(50);
movemouse(232, 129);
wait(50);
clickmouse(232, 129,true);
end;
end;

procedure c3;

begin
if iskeydown(chr(51)) then
begin
wait(50);
movemouse(231, 154);
wait(50);
clickmouse(231, 154,true);
end;
end;

procedure c4;

begin
if iskeydown(chr(52)) then
begin
wait(50);
movemouse(231, 177);
wait(50);
clickmouse(231, 177,true);
end;
end;

procedure c5;

begin
if iskeydown(chr(53)) then
begin
wait(50);
movemouse(231, 202);
wait(50);
clickmouse(231, 202,true);
end;
end;

procedure c6;

begin
if iskeydown(chr(54)) then
begin
wait(50);
movemouse(232, 225);
wait(50);
clickmouse(232, 225,true);
end;
end;

procedure c7;

begin
if iskeydown(chr(55)) then
begin
wait(50);
movemouse(233, 249);
wait(50);
clickmouse(233, 249,true);
end;
end;

procedure c8;

begin
if iskeydown(chr(56)) then
begin
wait(50);
movemouse(231, 274);
wait(50);
clickmouse(231, 274,true);
end;
end;

procedure c9;

begin
if iskeydown(chr(57)) then
begin
wait(50);
movemouse(232, 298);
wait(50);
clickmouse(232, 298,true);
end;
end;

procedure cq;

begin
if iskeydown(VK_A) then
begin
wait(50);
movemouse(256, 298);
wait(50);
clickmouse(256, 298,true);
end;
end;

procedure cw;

begin
if iskeydown(chr(87)) then
begin
wait(50);
movemouse(256, 274);
wait(50);
clickmouse(256, 274,true);
end;
end;

procedure ce;

begin
if iskeydown(chr(69)) then
begin
wait(50);
movemouse(256, 249);
wait(50);
clickmouse(256, 249,true);
end;
end;

procedure cr;

begin
if iskeydown(chr(82)) then
begin
wait(50);
movemouse(256, 225);
wait(50);
clickmouse(256, 225,true);
end;
end;

procedure ca;

begin
if iskeydown(chr(65)) then
begin
wait(50);
movemouse(258, 202);
wait(50);
clickmouse(258, 202,true);
end;
end;

procedure cs;

begin
if iskeydown(chr(83)) then
begin
wait(50);
movemouse(256, 177);
wait(50);
clickmouse(256, 177,true);
end;
end;

procedure cd;

begin
if iskeydown(chr(68)) then
begin
wait(50);
movemouse(257, 153);
wait(50);
clickmouse(257, 153,true);
end;
end;

procedure cf;

begin
if iskeydown(chr(70)) then
begin
wait(50);
movemouse(257, 130);
wait(50);
clickmouse(257, 130,true);
end;
end;

procedure cz;

begin
if iskeydown(chr(90)) then
begin
wait(50);
movemouse(257, 105);
wait(50);
clickmouse(257, 105,true);
end;
end;

procedure cx;

begin
if iskeydown(chr(88)) then
begin
wait(50);
movemouse(233, 249);
wait(50);
clickmouse(233, 249,true);
end;
end;

procedure check;
begin
if iskeydown(chr(20)) then
begin
wait(50);
getmousepos(x,y);
movemouse(x+476,y);
wait(50);
getmousepos(x,y);
clickmouse(x,y,true);
end;
end;

begin
repeat
c1;
c2;
c3;
c4;
c5;
c6;
c7;
c8;
c9;
cq;
cw;
ce;
cr;
ca;
cs;
cd;
cf;
cz;
check;

until isfkeydown(11);
end.
[/code]

I’m able to run the script. Pushing the keys 1-9 has the desired effects. But the other keys ( q,w,e,r,a,s,d,f,z, and Caps Lock) dont seem to work. They do nothing. What’s wrong with my script? I’m pretty sure the key codes are right. Is there another way I could get Scar to check if a specific key was pushed?

Edit: Ignore the VK_A, I was testing it.

Read full topic
